item.title: Hitcon CTF 2023 writeup
item.author: Author
item.description: This is a short writeup for the challenges I managed to solve in Hitcon CTF 2023. The challenges was not impossibly hard as I initially thought, but they was enjoyable nonetheless. Full Chain - The Blade Given file chal-the-blade Description A Rust tool for executing shellcode in a seccomp environment. Your goal is to pass the hidden flag checker concealed in the binary. Author: wxrdnx Basic analysis We are given an ELF file written in Rust.

item.title: [Sekai CTF 2023] Conquest of Camelot writeup
item.author: Author
item.description: Conquest of Camelot Given file camelot Description Unlock the secrets and unearth Camelot’s grail hidden within. Author: sahuang Basic analysis We are given a 64-bit ELF binary, and according to the challenge page, it’s written in OCaml. Throwing the binary to IDA and searching for the prompted string, we can locate the main logic of the program at camlDune__exe__Camelot__entry. I’ve never worked with (or heard about) Ocaml before, so the binary threw me off a little bit.

item.title: [TSJ CTF 2022] javascript_vm, w4nn4cryp7 writeup
item.author: Author
item.description: This is another CTF that I get to play with the people at team Project Sekai. The challenges are nice and interesting, and here are my writeups for the 2 RE challenges that I’ve managed to solve. javascript_vm Given file chall.bin VM source Description There are two kinds of Javascript virtual machines. Those who understand Javascript (like node.js) and those who don’t (like … ?). Author: @wxrdnx Writing a disassembler This is a classic vm chall.

item.title: A week with Angstromctf 2020
item.author: Author
item.description: So this postâ€™s gonna be in English. Why? I donâ€™t know, just feel like writing in English ðŸ™‚ I spent the whole week doing nothing but solving the RE challenges from Angstromctf (so far, I only managed to solve half of them, the easy half, that is). So I figured I should write a little bit about those challenges and what Iâ€™ve learned trying to solve them. Ok, here we go.
